entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: The main character of the story, mentioned as being concerned about Florean Fortescue's disappearance.

entities.name: florean fortescue
entities.description: A man who ran an ice-cream place in Diagon Alley and was known to Harry Potter for giving him free ice creams. He has been dragged off by unknown people.

entities.name: bill weasley
entities.description: One of the Weasley siblings, mentioned as being plied with wine by Fleur and asking about Florean Fortescue's disappearance.

entities.name: fleur
entities.description: A person who is serving wine to Bill Weasley and mentioned in the context of talking about Florean Fortescue's disappearance.

entities.name: remus lupin
entities.description: A person who is mentioned as knowing something about Florean Fortescue's disappearance and providing information to Harry Potter.

entities.name: mrs weasley
entities.description: The wife of Mr. Weasley, mentioned as being concerned about Bill's behavior and talking about Florean Fortescue's disappearance.

entities.name: mr weasley
entities.description: A person who is mentioned as talking about Ollivander's shop being empty and not knowing whether he left voluntarily or was kidnapped.

entities.name: ollivander
entities.description: A wand-maker whose shop in Diagon Alley is mentioned as being empty, with no sign of a struggle or forced departure.

entities.name: ginny weasley
entities.description: One of the Weasley siblings, mentioned as looking startled when hearing about Ollivander's shop being empty.

entities.name: diagon alley
entities.description: A location in the wizarding world where Florean Fortescue's ice-cream place and Ollivander's wand shop are located.

relationships.description: Harry Potter is concerned about Florean Fortescue's disappearance, as mentioned in the conversation with Bill Weasley.
Bill Weasley asks about Florean Fortescue's disappearance, showing his concern and interest in the matter.
Remus Lupin provides information about Florean Fortescue's disappearance, answering Harry Potter's questions.
Mr. Weasley mentions Ollivander's shop being empty and not knowing whether he left voluntarily or was kidnapped, showing his concern about the situation.
Ginny Weasley looks startled when hearing about Ollivander's shop being empty, showing her surprise and concern.
